intro: Arnebia euchroma subsp. euchroma, commonly known as Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of southern Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces striking red or pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its roots are the primary part used, containing high concentrations of the pigment rubiadin, which is used in traditional dyeing practices. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
